Part 4—Preservation of superior long service leave entitlements 48

Part 8—Repeal of Long Service Leave Act 1992 and savings and
Purposes
nodes.summary:
The purposes of this Act are— 
 (a) to make provision with respect to the 
long service leave entitlements of certain 
employees, including public and private 
sector employees and police officers; an...

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: to make provision with respect to the The purposes of this Act are— long service leave entitlements of certain employees, including public and private sector employees and police officers; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: to repeal the Long Service Leave Act 1992; and

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: to make consequential amendments to other Acts.

nodes.label: Commencement
nodes.summary:
(1) Subject to subsection (2), this Act comes into 
operation on a day to be proclaimed. 
 (2) If this Act does not come into operation before 
1 November 2018, it comes into operation on that 
day.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: Subject to subsection (2), this Act comes into operation on a day to be proclaimed.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: If this Act does not come into operation before 1 November 2018, it comes into operation on that day.

nodes.label: Act binds the Crown
nodes.summary:
This Act binds the Crown in right of Victoria and, 
so far as the legislative power of the Parliament 
permits, the Crown in all its other capacities.

nodes.summary:

continuous employment with one employer, an 
employee is entitled to an amount of long service 
leave on ordinary pay equal to 1/60th of the 
employee's total...

or annual leave

the period when the long service leave is taken.

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the employee is taken to have started long service leave on the day on which the employment ends; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the full amount of the employee's long service leave entitlement, calculated as at the day on which the employment ends, is due and payable to the employee on that day.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: This section sets out several situations in which an employee is taken, for the purposes of this Act, to have been employed by one employer despite having been employed during the relevant period by m...

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: If an employee is employed by a corporation, the employee is taken to have been employed by the corporation during any period that the employee was employed by—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: a related body corporate of the corporation (within the meaning of the Corporations Act); or

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: another corporation and— (i) the directors of that other corporation and the employee's present employer were substantially the same; or (ii) that other corporation and the employee's present employer...

nodes.label: Subsection 3
nodes.summary: If the ownership of a business employing an employee changes but the employment of the employee continues—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the employee is taken to have started employment with the new owner on the date on which the employee started employment at that business; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the new owner must not refuse to provide the employee any long service leave to which the employee is entitled, including long service leave which accrued before the change of ownership.

nodes.label: Subsection 4
nodes.summary: Subsection (3) applies regardless of whether the Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 11 change of ownership of the business occurred before or after the commencement of this Act.

nodes.label: Subsection 5
nodes.summary: If an employee is dismissed from employment by the owner of a business and is re-employed within 12 weeks after the day of the dismissal by a new owner of the same business to perform work for the new...

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: to have finished employment with the former owner on the day before the ownership of the business changed; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: to have started employment with the new owner on the day the ownership of the business changed; and

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: to have been employed by the new owner from the day on which the employee first started employment at that business.

nodes.label: Subsection 6
nodes.summary: If an employee performs duties in connection with any assets used in the carrying on of a business owned by the employee's employer and those assets are transferred to another employer who continues t...

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the employee is taken to have started employment with the new owner on the day on which the employee started employment at that business; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the new owner must not refuse to provide the employee any long service leave to which the employee is entitled, including long service leave which accrued before the transfer.

nodes.label: Subsection 7
nodes.summary: Subsection (8) applies if— Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 12

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: an employee performs duties in connection with any assets used in the carrying on of an employer's business; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the employee is dismissed by that employer; and

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: those assets are transferred to another employer; and

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: within 12 weeks after the day of the dismissal, the other employer employs the employee to perform duties in relation to those assets or other assets of a similar kind.

nodes.label: Subsection 8
nodes.summary: An employee referred to in subsection (7) is taken—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: to have finished employment with the employee's former employer on the day before the assets were transferred; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: to have started employment with the new employer on the day the assets were transferred; and

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: to have been employed by the new employer from the day on which the employee first started employment at that business.

nodes.label: Subsection 9

nodes.label: Paragraph a

nodes.label: Paragraph b

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: as a consequence of that contract, the Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 13 performed for the first-mentioned employer; and employee ceases employment with the first-mentioned employer and co...

nodes.label: Subsection 10
nodes.summary: An employee referred to in subsection (9) is taken to have started employment with the second-mentioned employer on the day on which the employee started employment with the first-mentioned employer.

nodes.label: Subsection 11
nodes.summary: The second-mentioned employer referred to in subsection (9) must not refuse to provide the employee any long service leave to which the employee is entitled, including long service leave which accrued...

nodes.label: Subsection 12
nodes.summary: In this section— assets includes tangible and intangible assets; business includes a trade, process and occupation and any part of a trade, process or occupation and also includes any part of a busine...

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: This section sets out several situations in which an employee is taken, for the purposes of this Act, to be continuously employed.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: An employee's employment is taken to be continuous despite an absence from work caused by the employee taking— amended by No. 44/2018 s. 81(2).

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: annual leave; or Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 14

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: because of a breakdown of machinery or Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 16 equipment for which the employer cannot reasonably be held responsible if the employee cannot be usefully employed...

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: because of a stoppage of work for any cause for which the employer cannot reasonably be held responsible if the employee cannot be usefully employed because of the stoppage.

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: an employer prevents an employee Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 17 from performing work under the employee's contract of employment without terminating that contract.

nodes.label: Paragraph e
nodes.summary: carer's leave; or

nodes.label: Paragraph f
nodes.summary: leave on account of illness or injury; or

nodes.label: Paragraph g
nodes.summary: any other form of leave not referred to in this subsection that is provided for under the relevant employment agreement.

nodes.label: Subsection 3
nodes.summary: A casual or seasonal employee's employment is taken to be continuous despite an absence from work that is longer than 12 weeks, starting at the end of a particular instance of employment and ending at...

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the casual or seasonal employee and the employer so agree before the start of the absence; or

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the absence is due to the terms of engagement of the casual or seasonal employee; or

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: the absence is caused by seasonal factors; or

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: the employee has been employed by the employer on a regular and systematic basis and the employee has a reasonable expectation of being re-engaged by the employer.

nodes.label: Subsection 4
nodes.summary: An employee's employment is taken to be Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 15 continuous despite an absence from work caused by the employer terminating or interrupting the employment with the...

nodes.label: Subsection 5
nodes.summary: An employee's employment is taken to be continuous despite an absence arising solely from the transfer of assets from one employer to another, if the employee usually performs duties which are connect...

nodes.label: Subsection 6
nodes.summary: An employee's employment is taken to be continuous despite an absence from work caused by the termination of the employee's employment—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: at the initiative of the employer or the employee, if the employee is re-employed by the employer within 12 weeks after the termination; or

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: because of the expiration of a specified term of an employment contract, if the employee is re-employed by the employer within 12 weeks after the expiration; or

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: because the employee's apprenticeship to an employer is completed, if the employee is re-employed by the employer within 52 weeks after the end of the apprenticeship.

nodes.label: Subsection 7
nodes.summary: An employee's employment is taken to be continuous despite the employer standing down the employee—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: during industrial action if the employee cannot be usefully employed because of the industrial action; or substituted by No. 44/2018 s. 81(3).

nodes.label: Subsection 8
nodes.summary: An employee's employment is taken to be continuous despite any interruption arising directly or indirectly from an industrial dispute. * * * * *

nodes.label: Subsection 9
nodes.summary: In this section— industrial action means any of the following kinds of action—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the performance of work by an employee in a manner different from that in which it is customarily performed, or the adoption of a practice in relation to work by an employee, the result of which is a...

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: a ban, limitation or restriction on the performance of work by an employee or on the acceptance of, or offering for, work by an employee;

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: a failure or refusal by employees to attend for work or a failure or refusal to perform any work at all by employees who attend for work; substituted by No. 44/2018 s. 81(3). repealed by No. 44/2018 s...

nodes.label: Subsection 10
nodes.summary: Despite anything to the contrary in subsection (9), industrial action does not include the following—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: action by employees that is authorised or agreed to by the employer of the employees;

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: action by an employer that is authorised or agreed to by, or on behalf of, employees of the employer;

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: action by an employee if— (i) the action was based on a reasonable concern of the employee about an imminent risk to the employee's health or safety; and (ii) the employee did not unreasonably fail to...

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: For the purposes of this Act, and subject to this pay section, ordinary pay—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: means the pay that an employee is entitled to receive on the day on which the employee starts long service leave, calculated on the employee's normal weekly hours at the employee's ordinary time rate...

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: includes the cash value of any board or lodging that an employee receives from the employee's employer.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: If an ordinary time rate of pay is not fixed for an employee's work under the relevant employment agreement, the employee's ordinary time rate of pay is the greatest of the following—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the average weekly rate earned by the employee in the 52 weeks immediately before the employee starts long service leave;

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the average weekly rate earned by the employee in the 260 weeks immediately before the employee starts long service leave;

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: the average weekly rate earned by the employee during the employee's period of continuous employment with the employer immediately before the employee starts long service leave.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: An employee may make a request to the employee's employer to take long service leave for a period of not less than 1 day.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: An employer must grant an employee's request to take long service leave as soon as practicable after receiving the request unless the employer has reasonable business grounds for refusing the request.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: An employee may request the employee's employer to grant the employee a period of long service leave—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: twice as long as the period to which the employee would otherwise be entitled; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: at a rate of pay equal to half the employee's ordinary pay.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: An employer must grant a request made under subsection (1) unless the employer has reasonable business grounds for refusing the request.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: The Industrial Division of the Magistrates' Court Magistrates' Court has—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to whether an employee is entitled to long service leave; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to whether an employee (or an employee's personal representative) is entitled to a payment in lieu of long service leave; and

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to an employer's refusal to grant long service leave under section 18(2); and

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to a direction to take long service leave under section 19(1), including the length of long service leave; and

nodes.label: Paragraph e
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to the rate of ordinary pay of an employee for the purposes of calculating a long service leave entitlement; and

nodes.label: Paragraph f
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to an employer's refusal to grant a request under section 22(2); and

nodes.label: Paragraph g
nodes.summary: jurisdiction to deal with an application as to payment of any amount owing to the employee (or the employee's personal representative) under this Act within the 6 years immediately before the day on w...

nodes.label: Paragraph h
nodes.summary: any other jurisdiction given to it by or under Long Service Leave Act 2018 No. 12 of 2018 29 this or any other Act.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: An employee (or an employee's personal representative) may apply to the Industrial Division of the Magistrates' Court for an order in relation to any matter referred to in subsection (1).
